name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): League of Legends
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): League of Legends
long_desc: With millions of players and an active competitive scene, League of Legends has become one of the biggest names in esports. This class is intended for players who are familiar with the game and wish to take their skill to the next level.

custom_fields.goals: The overall goals of the course are to help players improve their gameplay, critical thinking skills, and goalsetting skills, and to develop a passion for playing and bonding over video games, specifically, League of Legends.
custom_fields.key_topics: League of Legends Mechanics, Strategies, Trends, and Ways to Improve (in both a video game and in real life)
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Students are responsible for attendance, goal-setting, and keeping track of their progress. My class will work on a two-week schedule where every two weeks focuses on a different aspect of the game. I will have students draft up their own plan to practice the concepts that I cover the first week, and have them reflect on their progress the second week. They will share their plan and progress and consult me about it. Students will be responsible for two big assignments (one midterm and one final). The midterm will involve writing an essay on any aspect of the game, and the final will be an essay reflecting on all of the concepts that they learned, how they improved throughout the semester, and what they will do moving forward. While this course is primarily focused on playing a video game, the concepts of learning from your mistakes and developing a plan to improve can be applied to real life, and I would also like to see students reflect on their own lives and help them set goals outside of the video game.
custom_fields.relevance: With millions of players and an active competitive scene, League of Legends has become one of the most prominent names in esports. League of Legends is likely the most played video game at CMU and is a game that people can enjoy together and bond over.
custom_fields.learning_resources: My lectures will primarily be done via Google Slides and Youtube Videos, which will be shared with the students. I will also do "replay analysis" and individually analyze certain games, players, or play styles to demonstrate a concept. Students will also be added to an in-game club so that they can easily find and play with each other. They are encouraged to discuss the game and play together.
